intro: Trembleya rubra, commonly known as the red-flowered trembleya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red petals and velvety leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
